thread.title: Workington MP Sue Hayman meets Jeremy Hunt to push for better health care in Cumbria | Border
thread.title_full: Workington MP Sue Hayman meets Jeremy Hunt to push for better health care in Cumbria | Border - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Workington MP Sue Hayman meets Jeremy Hunt to push for better health care in Cumbria | Border
text:
From left to right: Dr Niall McGreevy, Dr Simon Desert, Cllr Alan Smith, Dr John Howarth and Sue Hayman MP. Credit: ITV Border Workington's MP Sue Hayman has met Jeremy Hunt, the Secretary of State for Health, to push for better care in Cumbria.
She was accompanied by GPs from Workington and Cockermouth Hospitals.
They want the Success Regime - a scheme to improve healthcare in the region - to include community hospitals in its plans, rather than just focusing on the Cumberland Infirmary and the West Cumberland Hospital.
Well there's certainly a real will in Government that it's going to work. What concerned me was that it is focusing too much on the acquisition by the Northumbria Trust and too much on the acute hospitals, without actually looking at the critical role that community based health services has to play in order to make it all successful. So that's what we were talking to the minister about.
â€“ Sue Hayman MP, Workington Labour Last updated Fri 23 Oct 2015 Politics Cumbria
